description: A little trick that has been keeping my desktop clean for years now.

description: Collection of hundreds of shortcuts for Windows, Mac and Linux.

name: Zen Habits
description: Blog by Leo Babauta with topics such as simplifying life.

name: Deep Work: Rules for Focused Success in a Distracted World
description: Deep work is the ability to focus without distraction on a cognitively demanding task.

description: A very simple and efficient time-management method.

name: The 5 Choices
description: An all around productivity methodology dealing with prioritization, scheduling, technology and energy management.

name: Box
description: Very good cloud storage solution for business customers.

description: Cloud storage solution deeply integrated in the Google ecosystem.

description: Best cloud storage solution for Windows users.

name: pCloud
description: A cloud storage solution with a strong focus on security.

description: Evernote can basically become your second brain and remember everything for you.

name: Google Keep
description: A nice and simple note management system tightly integrated with Google products.

name: Inkdrop
description: A cross-platform note taking application for Markdown lovers.

name: Joplin
description: A note taking and to-do application with synchronization capabilities.

name: Notion
description: An all-in-one very customizable workspace for notes, tasks, wikis and lists.

name: Yana
description: Powerful note-taking app with nested documents, full-text search, rich-text editor, code snippet editor and more.

name: OneNote
description: Very good note management solution, but best for Windows users.

name: Preserver
description: Notes organizer desktop application based on Electron.

name: Simplenote
description: Light, clean, and free. Simplenote is now available for iOS, Android, Mac, Windows, Linux, and the web.

name: Standard Notes
description: A simple and private notes application.

name: WorkFlowy
description: Outlining application for nested bulleted lists.

name: Airtable
description: Mix of spreadsheet and database to help organize work.

name: Amazing Marvin
description: Marvin incorporates principles from behavioral psychology to help beat procrastination, feel in control and finish todo list.

name: Any.do
description: Simple interface, packed with features, currently the favorite to-do list manager at Lifehacker.

name: GitHub Projects
description: A lesser known feature of GitHub, makes it easy to tie your project management process to your code.

name: Hitask
description: Easy Project and Task Management for Teams.

name: KanbanFlow

name: Microsoft To Do
description: Microsoft cloud-based task management application based on Wunderlist technology.

name: OmniFocus
description: A Getting Things Done based task manager for macOS and iOS.

name: Paymo
description: Keep your team aligned and engaged. Manage tasks, create team schedules, track work time, and bill your clients from the same platform.

name: Pomolectron
description: A pomodoro app for your menubar/tray.

name: Remember the Milk
description: Great at managing tags for to-dos and location based tasks.

name: Taskade
description: Simple and collaborative task lists for teams.

name: Taskwarrior
description: An open source command line task manager. Flexible, fast, efficient, and unobtrusive.

name: Timely
description: Automatic time tracking software. Get a flawless digital record of all project and team time, all without the hassle of manual timers and note taking.

name: Timing
description: Automatic time and productivity tracking for Mac. Helps you stay on track with your work and ensures no billable hours get lost if you are billing hourly.

name: Tinido
description: A beautiful and simple task management app that can also give you insights by showing your completed tasks in a contribution graph similar to the one you find on your GitHub profile.

name: Todo.txt
description: Tired of having complicated apps to organize your tasks? Todo.txt is a technique that uses a single .txt file to help you get the job done.

name: Todoist
description: Powerful and cross-platform productivity tool.

name: Topydo
description: A powerful todo list application using the todo.txt format, positioned between todo.txt CLI and Taskwarrior.

name: Trello
description: Kanban method task board.

name: Tweek
description: Super Simple To Do list and Weekly Task Management.

name: VivifyScrum
description: Agile project management app for teams that deliver. Customizable Scrum and Kanban boards.

name: Emoji Log
description: Calm, emoji-based tracker for arbitrary things that doesn't use streaks.

name: Everyday
description: Form new habits by doing things every day.

name: Habitica
description: Complete your real life daily goals in a role play game (previously called HabitRPG).

name: HabitBull
description: Premium habit tracker.

description: An Android app for creating and maintaining good habits.

name: Waka Time

name: Awesome AutoHotKey
description: AutoHotKey is a free, open-source macro-creation and automation software for Windows that allows users to automate repetitive tasks.

name: IFTTT

name: n8n
description: Open-source workflow automation for connecting web services with an option to self-host.

name: Qbserve
description: Mac time tracking automation: freelance project tracking, timesheets, invoicing & real-time productivity feedback.

name: Parabola

name: Tasker

name: Zapier
description: Automation tool that allows you to connect hundreds of web services and create automations between the processes.

name: Bitwarden
description: A free, trusted password manager that can store, sync, and generate passwords online or through native apps.

description: A free, open source, light-weight password manager with auto-type, browser and plugin support.

name: LastPass
description: A freemium password manager that stores encrypted passwords online.

name: Obie.ai
description: AI platform that brings all knowledge and documentation into one spot.

name: Obsidian.md
description: A knowledge base tool that works on local Markdown files. It allows you to create links between different notes.

name: Scribe
description: Automatically create step-by-step guides for any process. Simply hit “record” and Scribe will generate a detailed guide complete with screenshots based on your actions, ready to share with colleagues, customers, and friends.

name: Logseq
description: Logseq is a privacy-first, open-source knowledge base that works on top of local plain-text Markdown and Org-mode files. Use it to write, organize and share your thoughts, keep your to-do list, and build your own digital garden.

name: ShareX
description: Screen capture, file sharing and productivity tool.
